Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.path

Class PathWalker

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.path.PathWalker
public final class PathWalker
extends Object
Reads/writes objects using Path objects. The PathWalker class is useful for reading large batches of sparsely populated objects or maps. For some of these objects or maps, the PathWalker will not be able to follow a path all the way to the end. This can be due to any of the following reasons:

  • One of the intermediate path segments references a null value
  • The path is invalid given the type of the object to read/write
  • An array index within the path was out of bounds
  • The path continued after having reached a terminal value within the object (a primitive)

By default PathWalker will return null in these cases. If you need to distinguish between true nulls and the "dead ends" described above, you can instruct the PathWalker to return a special value, DEAD_END, in stead of null. You can also instruct to throw a NoSuchPropertyException. See PathWalker.DeadEndAction.

If the PathWalker is on a segment that references a Collection or an array, the next path segment must be an array index (unless it is the Collection or array itself that you want to retrieve). If it is not, it will silently assume you want the first element of the Collection or array.

Author:
Ayco Holleman

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  PathWalker.DeadEndAction
    Symbolic constants for what to do if the PathWalker hits a dead end for a particular Path.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static Object DEAD_END
    A special value indicating that a path could not be walked all the way to the end for the object currently being read.

    • PathWalker

      public PathWalker​(List<Path> paths, PathWalker.DeadEndAction deadEndAction)
      Creates a PathWalker for the specified paths. If useDeadEndValue equals true, then the value for a path that could not be walked will be DEAD_END, else null. If it is important to distinguish between "real" null values and dead ends, pass true.
      Parameters:
      paths -
      deadEndAction -

    • PathWalker

      public PathWalker​(List<Path> paths, PathWalker.DeadEndAction deadEndAction, Function<Path,​Object> mapKeyDeserializer)
      Creates a PathWalker for the specified paths. If useDeadEndValue equals true, then the value for a path that could not be walked will be DEAD_END, else null. If it is important to distinguish between "real" null values and dead ends, pass true. If you need to read from or write to maps with non-string keys, you must provide a function that deserializes a path segment into a map key.
      Parameters:
      paths - The paths to walk
      deadEndAction - The action to take if a path could not be walked all the way to the end.
      mapKeyDeserializer - A function that converts strings to map keys (may be null if no deserialization is required)

  • Method Details

    • readValues

      public Object[] readValues​(Object host) throws PathWalkerException
      Returns the values of all paths within the provided object in the same order as the paths specified through the constructor.
      Parameters:
      host - The object to read the path values from
      Returns:
      Throws:
      PathWalkerException

    • readValues

      public void readValues​(Object host, Object[] output) throws PathWalkerException
      Reads the values of all paths within the provided object and places them in the provided output array. The values will be in the same order as the paths specified through the constructors. The length of the output array must be greater than or equal to the number of paths specified through the constructor.
      Parameters:
      host - The object from which to read the values
      output - An array into which to place the values
      Throws:
      PathWalkerException

    • readValues

      public void readValues​(Object host, Map<Path,​Object> output) throws PathWalkerException
      Reads the values of all paths within the provided object and places them in the provided path-to-value map.
      Parameters:
      host - The object from which to read the values
      output - An Map into which to put the values
      Throws:
      PathWalkerException

    • read

      public <T> T read​(Object host)
      Returns the value of the first path. Useful if the PathWalker was created with just one path.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the object that the path points to
      Parameters:
      host - The object to read the path values from
      Returns:
      Throws:
      PathWalkerException

    • writeValues

      public boolean writeValues​(Object host, Object... values)
      Sets the values of all configured paths to the specified values. This method returns true if all values were successfully writen. If the configured PathWalker.DeadEndAction is THROW_EXCEPTION, this method will throw a PathWalkerException detailing the error of the write action that failed, otherwise this method returns false.
      Parameters:
      host -
      values -
      Whether - or not all values were successfully writen.

    • write

      public boolean write​(Object host, Object value)
      Sets the value of the first path within the provided object to the specified value. Useful if the PathWalker was created for just one path. This method will return true if the value was successfully written to the host object. If the configured PathWalker.DeadEndAction is THROW_EXCEPTION, this method will throw a PathWalkerException detailing the error, otherwise this method will return false.
      Parameters:
      host -
      value -
      Returns:
      Whether or not the value was successfully written
